etymology.description: 广(廣) (guǎng, "shelter") + 付(付) (fù, "hand over") = place where things are handed over -> government office or administrative building
etymology.interpretation: The character 府(fǔ, "government office") combines the semantic element 广(廣) (guǎng, "shelter") and the phonetic element 付(付) (fù, "hand over") to suggest a shelter or building where administrative transactions take place.

examples.chinese: 他参观了总统府(他參觀了總統府)。
开封府曾经闻名遐迩(開封府曾經聞名遐迩)，吸引了众多游客(吸引了眾多遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Kāifēng fǔ céngjīng wénmíng xiá'ěr, xīyǐnle zhòngduō yóukè.
examples.english: The Kaifeng government office was once famous and attracted many tourists.
